text: as I read about each of the 70 who died
I thought of Otto Frank not being a
father anymore when it comes to book
readings John Green is a pro he has done
hundreds of them and he knows how to
work the crowd the 35 year old author
continues to tour for his book The Fault
in Our Stars which has spent a year on
the New York Times bestseller list his
readings still draw huge crowds a fact
that Greene cherishes you feel the
energy of the crowd and that's a great
blessing because you know I need that
energy then to try to give back to them
yet john green's popularity is also
rooted in his life online where he has
become a youtube sensation
together with his younger brother Hank
the writer started a simple video series
that became a runaway success I hope you
won't be insulted by this Hank but I'm
surprised that you're so smart and funny
in 2007 they posted daily messages to
each other on the website and Hank's
homage to a certain young wizard changed
everything the day before the last Harry
Potter book was published Hank uploaded
a song called Accio Deathly Hallows that
was all about how excited he was for the
book and how he didn't want to wait
anymore and the Harry Potter fan
community really embraced this song
because I mean Harry Potter now we have
about nine hundred thousand subscribers
on YouTube 270 million video views and
and every day you know we get more than
a thousand new subscribers the green
brothers popularity online has had a big
impact on John's career not only does
Hank join him frequently at readings now
but with nearly a million copies in
print and sold online his current book
could reach sales figures ten times
greater than his previous release this
week John Green also got an opportunity
authors with less social media cachet
are unlikely to receive together with
his brother Hank his favorite band the
mountain goats and guests like a folk
singer Kimya Dawson John played a
sold-out show at
Carnegie Hall I could never have
imagined that you know books in YouTube
can end at Carnegie Hall
